info.name: Agent API
info.description:
The [Agent API](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/einstein/genai/guide/agent-api.html) lets you use Agentforce from third party applications.

üìö [Agent API Reference](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/einstein/genai/guide/agent-api.html)

‚ö†Ô∏è **Disclaimers:**

- Agent API is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at [Agreements - Salesforce.com](https://www.salesforce.com/company/legal/agreements/) or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the [Product Terms Directory](https://ptd.salesforce.com/?_ga=2.247987783.1372150065.1709219475-629000709.1639001992). Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.
- This collection is not covered by Salesforce support and SLAs.
- Each call to the Agent API consumes Einstein Requests. To learn more, see [Generative AI Billable Usage Types](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.generative_ai_usage.htm) and [Rate Card for Einstein Requests](https://www.salesforce.com/content/dam/web/en_us/www/documents/einstein-platform-sku-rate-card-base-co-create.pdf).

## Setup

The Agent API requires access to Einstein Generative AI on your Salesforce Org. If you don't have an Org with this feature, you can get an [Agentforce Playground org](https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/projects/quick-start-build-your-first-agent-with-agentforce/configure-an-agentforce-service-agent) from Trailhead to experiment.

1. [Fork](https://app.getpostman.com/run-collection/12721794-8612c754-9efc-4ea1-b876-e8f9af0fe09d?action=collection%2Ffork&source=rip_markdown&collection-url=entityId%3D12721794-8612c754-9efc-4ea1-b876-e8f9af0fe09d%26entityType%3Dcollection%26workspaceId%3D34382471-0c97-40e5-a206-f947271665c4) this collection.
2. Follow these instructions from the official documentation:
  1. [Create a Connected App](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/einstein/genai/guide/agent-api-get-started.html#create-a-connected-app)
  1. [Add Connected App to Agent](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/einstein/genai/guide/agent-api-get-started.html#add-connected-app-to-agent)
  1. [Obtain Credentials](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/einstein/genai/guide/agent-api-get-started.html#obtain-credentials)
3. Paste the **Copy Consumer Key** and **Consumer Secret** respectively in the `clientId` and `clientSecret` collection variables.
4. From Setup, go to `My Domain`, and then copy the value of **Current My Domain URL** into the `sfOrgDomain` collection variable.
5. From Setup, go to `Agents`, select the agent that you want to interact with and and then copy value of the agent ID (a value starting with `0Xx.....`) from the browser URL into the `agentId` collection variable.
6. Save your collection variables.
7. Open the **Authorization** tab of the Postman collection and click **Get New Access Token** at the bottom of the screen.
8. Click **Use Token**.
9. Select the **Start Session** request and click **Send** to open a session.
10. Send a prompt: select the **Send Message - Streaming** request, modify the body with your prompt and click **Send**.

## Variables Reference

The collection relies on the following required variables:

| Variable | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `sfApiHost` | Salesforce API host. Either `https://api.salesforce.com` for production or `https://test.salesforce.com` for sandboxes. |
| `sfOrgDomain` | Salesforce Org domain with `https://`. See **My Domain** in Salesforce Setup for value. |
| `clientId` | Connected App Consumer Key. |
| `clientSecret` | Connected App Consumer Secret. |
| `agentId` | Agent ID starting with `0Xx.....`. |
| `_sessionId` | The agent session ID. Do not modify this value, it is handled automatically when creating a session. |

response.name: Create Session

exec: throw new Error(`Start a session with the appropriate request first.`);

request.description: Send a synchronous message to the agent on an active session.

response.name: Send Message - Synchronous

exec: throw new Error(`Start a session with the appropriate request first.`);

request.description: Send a streaming message to the agent on an active session. Returns an SSE stream in the response.

response.name: Send Message - Streaming

request.description: Send a message to the agent to end a session.
Submit feedback for a message. Feedback data is stored in Data Cloud.

exec: throw new Error(`Missing mandatory configuration variable: ${key}`);
throw new Error(`Configuration variable ${key} value must include 'https://' protocol.`);
